Git Watch

github.com/AptElements/git-watch

Getting Started

  1. Set up a GitHub WebHook to http://git.watch/github/ with an optional secret. You can also Do it automatically
  2. Install the client npm install -g gitwatch-client (use the latest Node.js)
  3. Listen for push events: git-watch --url=http://git.watch/github/AptElements/git-watch --push-execute='echo deploying %sha% %ref%'

Notes

Security

  • The client-side application has explicit filters to ensure no injection takes place.
  • Everything is open to the world.
  • If you want to ensure legitimate github requests, add the --secret=[secret you specified] option to git-watch

Deploying only master

git-watch \
--url=http://git.watch/github/AptElements/git-watch \
--push-execute='
ref="%ref%"
if [ "$ref" = "refs/heads/master" ]; then
cd /path/to/repo &&
git pull origin $ref &&
echo "Updated $ref"
fi'
